intro: Scorodocarpus borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo scorodocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded conditions. Its unique botanical features make it an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
